text: Hi All - I had set up a custom blog listing page and realized our category and author pages are no longer showing up correctly (they just show the same listing page). Could someone point me in the right direction? Many thanks! <https://blog.mktgessentials.com/>
It looks like the author urls are working fine. Ensure your HUBL in the blog template is there to show the author info when you get to the correct url.
Do you need Dev Help?
The author URLS and the tag URLS pull up new pages. However, they look identical to the main blog feed page.
true. that is because they are using the same template. There must be a section in the template that calls some "Author Info" to display that along side of the posts for that author.
There are things that can be done. Depending on how the template was built.
my firefox icon is purdy blue for the developer edition
wish I could be the hipster that comes in and says Chromium or Brave, but I just can't leave my chrome dev tools :heart:

when I read “hipster” I thought for sure you were gonna mention Opera.

I feel like the attitude among Opera people is “I used opera before and after it was cool. :dark_sunglasses:”
look how pretty!
oh gawd, I’m not color blind but why is everything like a shade of purple
prince?
lead designer
emphasis on after lol :stuck_out_tongue:
Firefox Dev tools FTW :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
1, 2, 3, 4 I declare a browser war!

We develop websites by writing out the code on a piece of paper, scanning it into a PDF, copying the  converted editable text from there and pasting it into a PowerPoint doc where it is then emailed to IE HQ. They send us back an AOL Online CD with the code on the disk as a .mp3. We then open the .mp3 in Realplayer and hold Siri up to the speaker to transcribe it. We then paste the Google search from Siri into the notes app, where through the magic of the cloud we can also view it on our laptops. We then paste this into a Microsoft Word document which is loaded onto the site via Node.
beautiful
sounds similar to dreamweaver
We found that this was a little more straightforward than DW
ha!
the phrase "AOL Online" still makes me cringe
